newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends lower against doller.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends lower against doller.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka ended lower at 43.7440/7490 to the dollar in interbank trading on Tuesday amid higher demand for dollar from importers, dealers said.
The take opened at 43.7430/7490, against previous closing at 43.7350/7450, and remained weak during the day's trading, they said.

The interbank call money rates closed higher at eight percent to 10 percent against the previous 7.75-8.75 percent. Demand for funds ahead of Moslem Eid al-Adha festival later this week pushed the rates higher, dealers said.
